biblinkcreator

Class DataDownloader

  • java.lang.Object
    • biblinkcreator.DataDownloader

  • public class DataDownloader
extends java.lang.Object
    A mechanism that downloads data by utilizing APIs from various bibliographic sources and saves them into semantic repositories.

    Author: David Nazarian

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  DataDownloader.SourceType
      An enumeration for the download APIs.

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the connection to the source repository providing the identifiers to be queried during the data downloading via an API.

      • downloadData

        public int downloadData(java.lang.String extractionQueryA,
                        java.lang.String extractionQueryB,
                        DataStructure.RepositoryInfo destRepositoryInfo,
                        DataDownloader.SourceType sourceType,
                        Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                        DataStructure.StringFormatData sourceStringFormatData,
                        DataStructure.StringFormatData destStringFormatData)
        Downloads data via an API and returns the number of downloaded records.
        Parameters:
        extractionQueryA - A SPARQL query which will extract the identifiers from the source repository, to be queried and downloaded via an API. Its select clause must contain a variable with the name of the identifier, e.g. ?isbn. The variable names for the identifiers can be retrieved by using the getIdentifierVariableName method of the Identifier class.
        extractionQueryB - A SPARQL query which will extract the identifiers from the destination repository (a repository containing already downloaded data) so that they are excluded from the downloads. Its select clause must contain a variable with the name of the identifier.
        destRepositoryInfo - Information about the destination repository where the downloaded records will be transferred to.
        sourceType - The download API to be used.
        identifierType - The type of the queried identifier.
        sourceStringFormatData - (Optional) Extra preprocessing information for the identifiers extracted from the source repository.
        destStringFormatData - (Optional) Extra preprocessing information for the identifiers extracted from the destination repository.
        Returns:
        The number of downloaded records.

      • downloadArXivData

        public int downloadArXivData(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> identifierSet,
                             Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                             org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection destRepositoryConn,
                             Schema schema)
        Downloads data via the arXiv API. For the rules and limitations (the maximum number of identifiers in a single query, delay between consecutive queries etc.) please consult the API's documentation https://arxiv.org/help/api/user-manual
        The API must be used only after conformity with the specified rules.
        Parameters:
        identifierSet - A set of identifiers to be queried.
        identifierType - The type of the queried identifier.
        destRepositoryConn - Connection to the destination repository where the downloaded data will be saved.
        schema - Provides structure for the saved data.
        Returns:
        The number of downloaded records.

      • downloadHathiTrustData

        public int downloadHathiTrustData(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> identifierSet,
                                  Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                                  org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection destRepositoryConn,
                                  Schema schema)
        Downloads data via the HathiTrust API. For the rules and limitations (the maximum number of identifiers in a single query, delay between consecutive queries etc.) please consult the API's documentation https://www.hathitrust.org/bib_api
        The API must be used only after conformity with the specified rules.
        Parameters:
        identifierSet - A set of identifiers to be queried.
        identifierType - The type of the queried identifier.
        destRepositoryConn - Connection to the destination repository where the downloaded data will be saved.
        schema - Provides structure for the saved data.
        Returns:
        The number of downloaded records.

      • downloadOpenLibraryData

        public int downloadOpenLibraryData(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> identifierSet,
                                   Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                                   org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection destRepositoryConn,
                                   Schema schema)
        Downloads data via the Open Library API. For the rules and limitations (the maximum number of identifiers in a single query, delay between consecutive queries etc.) please consult the API's documentation https://openlibrary.org/dev/docs/api/books
        The API must be used only after conformity with the specified rules.
        Parameters:
        identifierSet - A set of identifiers to be queried.
        identifierType - The type of the queried identifier.
        destRepositoryConn - Connection to the destination repository where the downloaded data will be saved.
        schema - Provides structure for the saved data.
        Returns:
        The number of downloaded records.

      • downloadPubMedData

        public int downloadPubMedData(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> identifierSet,
                              Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                              org.openrdf.repository.RepositoryConnection destRepositoryConn,
                              Schema schema)
        Downloads data via the PubMed API. For the rules and limitations (the maximum number of identifiers in a single query, delay between consecutive queries etc.) please consult the API's documentation https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/books/NBK25497/
        The API must be used only after conformity with the specified rules.
        Parameters:
        identifierSet - A set of identifiers to be queried.
        identifierType - The type of the queried identifier.
        destRepositoryConn - Connection to the destination repository where the downloaded data will be saved.
        schema - Provides structure for the saved data.
        Returns:
        The number of downloaded records.

      • getWorldCatDataSelectionQuery

        public java.lang.String getWorldCatDataSelectionQuery(Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType)
        Gets a SPARQL query which can be used to retrieve data downloaded via the WorldCat API.
        Parameters:
        identifierType - The type of the identifier.
        Returns:
        The data selection SPARQL query.

      • getDownloadedDataSelectionQuery

        public java.lang.String getDownloadedDataSelectionQuery(Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                                                        Schema schema)
        Gets a SPARQL query which can be used to retrieve data downloaded via the arXiv, HathiTrust, Open Library and PubMed API.
        Parameters:
        identifierType - The type of the identifier.
        schema - The structure information of the saved data.
        Returns:
        The data selection SPARQL query.
